Vita & passio sancte Cecilie virginis & martiris.
Seinte Cecilie, of noble kynde I-bore &yogh;e was at rome
Oure louerd crist &yogh;e louede wel ar &yogh;e fram cradel come
Stilleliche &yogh;e hire let bapti&yogh;e, as we fynden I-wryte
To oure louerd crist &yogh;e bad &yogh;erne hire maydenhod to wyte
So þat þoru strengþe of hire frendes I-spoused &yogh;e was to a man
Of gret nobleye &yogh; of richesse, his name was Vallerian
Þis mayde werede robe of pal &yogh; cloþes swiþe riche
Garlaundes &yogh; tressoures of gold—þe here next hire liche
Whane &yogh;e herde menstrales song, . &yogh;e song in hire menstralcieAsh. Wen þe m. songe hor song: of hor m.
Þis mayde stiliche song of god &yogh; of his moder marye
A vers of þe psalter hire song was, wer-on was mast hire þout
"Lat, louerd, myn herte wiþoute wem be, þt it confundet be naut"
A-ny&yogh;t as &yogh;e was in riche bed wiþ hire lord i-brouth
Sone he hadde of folye þis clene mayde be-sout
"Swete herte," þis mayde seyde, "for loue þou hast to me
Graunte me y mowe þe telle a litel pryuete
Þat ich me mowe þerof schryue, &yogh;. þt þou it wille hele"
"Certes, lemman," þis &yogh;ungman seyde, "noþing telle I nele"
"Suete lemman," þis mayde seyde, "in warde icham I-do
An aungel of heuene is my wardeyn, &yogh; my lemman þer-to
Wel faste he stant her bi me. &yogh;if he vnder&yogh;ete
Þat þou be-nome my maydenhod, noþing nolde he lete
Þat he ne wolde harde smyte, &yogh; be-nyme þe þi my&yogh;tte
Of þi &yogh;ungnesse &yogh; of noble stat, for þou ne my&yogh;th wiþ him fy&yogh;tthe
Ac &yogh;if he wiste þou louedest me in gode loue &yogh; clene
WytteMS. wytie? he wolde þe als he deþ me, &yogh; al yuel fro þe &yogh;ene"
"&YOGH;if þou wilt," seyde Vallerian, "þat ich I-leue þis
Þen angel þou most me schewe, þat I se hym I-wis
&YOGH; wanne I þat soþe i-se, þat þou hast soþ i-seyd
In clenesse for-soþe þi wille I do, al after þi red
&YOGH;if I se þat in folye þou louest anoþer þan me
No-þing ne schal &yogh;ou helpe, þat I ne sle him &yogh; þe"
"Swete herte," seyde þat mayde, "&yogh; þou wile þe aungel se
Þou most bileuen on Ihesu crist &yogh; I-cristned be
&YOGH; sen him þou schalt &yogh;if þou wilt so; he þe wile wytteMS. wytie? fro helle
So gret ioye of oure loue schal be þat no tunge ne may telle
Ac henne ouer þre myle þou most gon þe wey toal. of apye
Þere [pore] men þou schalt fynde on Ihesu crist faste crye
Sey þt ich to hem þe sende, &yogh; þt he þe teche anon
Whar is seint vrban þe holi old man, for þou most to him gon
ffor priue counseil þou wilt wiþ him speke. &yogh; he þe schal bapti&yogh;e
&YOGH; þanne þou schalt þan angel se, &yogh; do as he þe wile wise"
Vallerian a-ros a-non, as oure louerd him &yogh;af wille
To þe stede þe mayde bad he wende forþ wel stille
Þes pore men him taute a-non to þe olde seint vrban
he fond him in an old for-late stede, þatr. þer wonede neuere man
Among puttes &yogh; burieles als men cristene men þreu
After þat he martired were, men anye kneu(!)
To his feet he ful a-doun a-kne, als-sone asoverlined. [he] to him come
&YOGH; seyde þat cesilie send him þider to asken cristendome
"Louerd, I-herd be þi my&yogh;tte," seyde seint vrban
"Weþer þis be þat Luþere werreor men clepuþ vallerian
Were cecilie haue him now y-mad, him þt was so wilde
&YOGH; more tyrant þan any wolf, als a lomb he isom. he is now mylde"
Þo com þer go a swiþe old man a ly&yogh;tthe fro heuene þer
hor, wiþ whyte vestemens, a swiþe fair wryt he ber
Þo vallerian ital. him I-sey, a-doun he fel for drede
Seint vrban nom him vp a&yogh;en . &yogh; gan him forþ lede
Þis halewe of heuene tok him þat wryt, &yogh; bad him forto rede
Vallerian tok it anon, & þus þe wordes sede
"OnMS. Oure louerd is, .&yogh;. on bi-leue, .&yogh; on bapti&yogh;ingge
On god .&yogh; fader of alle þat beþ, þt oueral is .&yogh; in eche þingge"
"I-leuestou þis," quaþ seint vrban, "þat þou dost her I-se"
"Þer nis noþing," quaþ þis oþer, "þat bet to leue be"
After þis whyte man he be-held; he nuste wher he be-cam
Seint vrban him nom a-non, &yogh; &yogh;af him cristendom
To sein Cecilie he wente a&yogh;en, þo he was þare is fulle
he fond hire chambre ly&yogh;th wiþ-inne, .&yogh; swiþe swote smulle
he fond cecilie, his gode spouse, &yogh; an aungel wiþ hire stonde
Bry&yogh;ttere þan any lemeMS. lome; twey garlondes he hadde on honde
Of rose &yogh; of lilie swote; þat on, cecilie he tok
&YOGH; þat oþer, vallerian, as we fynden in bok
"Wyteþ þis wiþ trewe loue, wiþ chaste body &yogh; clene
Ich hem habbe fro heuene i-brou&yogh;th, oure lord hem doþ &yogh;ou lene
ffor-falewe ne olde wille þei nat, ac euere he willeþ laste
Two manere floures þer beþ on, nelle neuere here heu caste
Þe lilie be-tokneþ &yogh;oure maydenhod, þt is so whyt &yogh; swote
Þe rose be-tokneþ &yogh;oure martirdom; for þer-on deye &yogh;e mote
And for þou dest, vallerian, cecilie red so sone
What þou be-sekest of my lord, he wille þe graunte sone"
"I ne willeal. wilny noþing so miche," seyde vallerian
"Boteal. As þat Tiburs,MS. Tiburft my broþer, wiþ me were cristeneman"
"Mi lord," quaþ þis aungel, "wile &yogh;iuen þat ilke grace
&YOGH; boþe &yogh;e schulle I-martired be at o tyme, in o place"
Þe aungel [wende] wiþ þis word, he nuste wher he be-com
Þis two clene þingges ioye I-now ech of oþer nom
Tiburs com to chambre &yogh; spacal. to speke wiþ his broþer þere
he stod &yogh; be-held al-a-boute als he nuste wher he were
"Broþer," he seyde, "hou goþ þis? þis tyme of þe &yogh;ere
So swote smul ne smelde I neuere, me þinkþ, as I do here
Þei þis hous were ful of newe roses &yogh; of lylie also
I ne my&yogh;tte hem versschere smelle, me þinkþ, þan I now do
So ful ich am al of þe smul, &yogh; so muche it is in my þout
Þat Ich am for-soþe in an-oþer wytte I-brouth"
"Leue broþer," quaþ vallerian, "garlandes we habbeþ here
Of floures þat þou ne my&yogh;t i-se bote þou were oure fere
als þou hast þane swote smel þar-of for oure bone
&YOGH;if þou wilt be-leue as we, þou my&yogh;t sen hem sone"
"Leue broþer," seyde þis oþer, "wheþur it be soþ þis
Oþer I stonde in matyngge .&yogh; mete þat so it is"
"In metyngge," quaþ vallerian, "we habbeþ euere I-be
Nou we ben ferst of slepe a-waked, nou we mowe ferst i-se"
"Sestow nou bet," quaþ þis oþer, "þan þou hast er I-do"
"&YOGH;e," seyde vallerian, "wel soneal. om. me be-houeþ so
ffor my lordes aungel of heuene haþ I-&yogh;oue me sy&yogh;th
&YOGH; for oure loue he þe schal also, &yogh;if þou wile leue a-ry&yogh;th"
Þo seyde þis holy mayde: "tibors, leue broþer
What ben maumettes bote wrechedhede? þou sest on hem non oþer

"To-day þou schalt my broþer be, for þou wilt don be rede
Þoru clene loue &yogh; good be-leue þi broþer my spouse is
Þar-þoru þou schalt be-come also my broþer when þou art his
Mid Vallerian þou most go to þe bisschop Vrban

And þei þe blisse of heuen þinke lite, . mechul &yogh; swete it is"
"Beaus amys, me þynkþ þat &yogh;e ben wode:
worþe he is to habbe wo, who-so ne keput nat of gode"

So þat he &yogh; alle his þorw hem cristene bi-com

Whare aungles here soules nome &yogh; to heuene baren an hey
To þe Iustise he &yogh;ede anon : "cristene ich am," he sede
"Ich i-sey þe godemannesal. menne soule aungles to heuene lede"
Þe Iustise him let nymen a non, naked he let him bete
Wiþ stronge skourgen, faste i-bounde, forto he gan þat lif lete
Þe body þei casten wiþoute þe toun. þo gan cecilie forþ gon

"What," sede he, "hou goþ þis? beþ þer &yogh;et schrewen mo
artou Vallerianus wif? be þe fey Ich owe mahoun
Bote þou oþer do, þi wythal. wite heu worþ sone I-brouth a-doun
Of what kynne artou of y-come, þt þus foleliche wiltal. þe doþ lere"
"Of betere kunne," quaþ cecilie, "þan þou euere were"
"In wich-maner lif," quaþ þis oþer, "þenkest tou to lyue"

Þat þou ne schalt fro ihesu cryst ones myn herte wende"

To clepe me fol þat am þi maister? ne sixte nower my peral. poer"

Als þi caroigne wiþ siknesse, wreche, a-dwyne schal
Þi poer þat þou &yogh;elpest of, boþe is þenne &yogh; lite"

Gydi &yogh; blind þou schalt deye, in helle pyne deye"
